render.tex: %text \textcolor{blue}{\text{Standard Integrals \#2}} Integrals of inverse trigonometric functions %

reason.tex:
%text The following integrals follow straight the derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
% \begin{tabular}{l|l} \hline \text{Derivative} & \text{Integral} \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\sin^{-1}x = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} & \int \frac{dx}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} = \sin^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\cos^{-1} x = -\frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} & \int\frac{dx}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} = -\cos^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\tan^{-1}x = \frac{1}{1+x^2} & \int\frac{dx}{1+x^2} = \tan^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\cot^{-1} x = \frac{-1}{1+x^2} & \int\frac{dx}{1+x^2} = -\cot^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\sec^{-1} x = \frac{1}{x\sqrt{x^2-1}} & \int\frac{dx}{x\sqrt{x^2 - 1}} = \sec^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \frac{d}{dx}\csc^{-1} x = \frac{-1}{x\sqrt{x^2-1}} & \int\frac{dx}{x\sqrt{x^2 - 1}} = -\csc^{-1} x + C \\ \hline \end{tabular}
